CurrentSanctionOutcome.DecisionSummary:
On 28 February 2013 the Authority made a decision to suspend the Agent’s registration for a period of two years and until certain conditions are met.

The Authority investigated a complaint against the Agent which related to the Agent’s conduct as a registered migration agent.

Following this investigation the Authority was satisfied that the Agent had breached the following clauses of the Code of Conduct: 2.9A, 2.23, 5.5, 7.2, 8.1, 8.2, 8.5 and 9.1.

The Authority was satisfied that the Agent:
- failed to deal with the complainant competently, diligently and fairly by not properly supervising the work carried out by her employee, Mr Aguilar;
- failed to exercise control over her office for the purpose of giving immigration advice and assistance;
- failed to ensure that her employee was of good character and acted in accordance with the Code of Conduct in the course of his employment; and
- failed to take all reasonable steps to maintain the reputation and integrity of the migration advice profession.

The Authority was also satisfied that the Agent was not a person of integrity or a fit and proper person to provide immigration assistance.

Taking into account the serious consequences and impact that the Agent's conduct had on the complainant, and the fact that her registration had been previously suspended in relation to similar conduct, the Authority considered that a decision to suspend the Agent’s registration for a period of two years, with conditions, was warranted in the circumstances.

An abridged version of the decision is attached below. Details of client have been removed in the interests of protecting the privacy of the parties involved. The removed portions are denoted by square brackets.

The Agent has applied for a review of this decision to the Administrative Appeals Tribunal.
